sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"名称"之意。
means: title ： 指书名、剧目或其他文艺创作作品
名称，也指附在姓名前的职称或头衔。
name ： 最普通用词，指人、动物或事物的姓名、名称或名字，也指在特定情况下给予人或事物的特殊名称以体现其内在特点。

sentence.Network_en: Its new title was meant to give the party greater public appeal.
sentence.Network_cn: 新的党名意在使该党对公众具有更强的吸引力。

sentence.Network_en: The heavyweight champion will be given a shot at Holyfield's world title.
sentence.Network_cn: 这名重量级拳击冠军将尝试挑战霍利菲尔德的世界冠军头衔。

sentence.Network_en: They wanted me to change the title to something less gratuitously offensive.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们希望我将题目修改一下，以免显得太过冒犯。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English titul, reinforced by Old French title, both from Latin titulus 'inscription, title'. The word originally denoted a placard or inscription placed on an object, giving information about it, hence a descriptive heading in a book or other composition

encyclopedia.content: HTML中的title注释 TITLE 元素仅可在 HEAD 元素内使用。位于 TITLE 开闭标签之内的文本都会在浏览器的标题栏和 Microsoft Windows 的任务栏上显示。对于 Web 页，“Internet Explorer”会被自动追加到标题后。而在 HTML 应用程序(HTA)中，仅会显示指定的标题。 要使用脚本在程序中设置标题，请使用 document.title 而不是设置 title 对象的 innerHTML 属性。 此元素在 Internet Explorer 3.0 及以上版本的 HTML 中可用，在 Intern

entry.def: The title of a book, play, film, or piece of music is its name.

example.ex: 'Patience and Sarah' was first published in 1969 under the title 'A Place for Us'.
example.tran: 《佩兴丝与萨拉》一书最初于1969年出版时以《属于我们的地方》为名。

entry.def: When a writer, composer, or artist titles a work, they give it a title.

example.ex: Pirandello titled his play 'Six Characters in Search of an Author'...
example.tran: 皮兰德娄把他的戏剧命名为《六个寻找作者的剧中人》。

entry.def: Publishers and booksellers often refer to books or magazines as titles .

example.ex: It has become the biggest publisher of new poetry in Britain, with 50 new titles a year.
example.tran: 它成为英国最大的新诗出版商，每年推出新书 50 种。

entry.def: A person's title is a word such as 'Sir', 'Lord', or 'Lady' that is used in front of their name, or a phrase that is used instead of their name, and indicates that they have a high rank in society.

example.ex: Her husband was also honoured with his title 'Sir Denis'...
example.tran: 她丈夫也被封为“丹尼斯爵士”。

example.ex: Princess Alexandra was to inherit the title of Duchess of Fife…
example.tran: 亚历山德拉公主将会继承法夫女公爵的爵位。

entry.def: Someone's title is a word such as 'Mr', 'Mrs', or 'Doctor', that is used before their own name in order to show their status or profession.

example.ex: She has been awarded the title Professor.

entry.def: Someone's title is a name that describes their job or status in an organization.

example.ex: He was given the title of deputy prime minister…
'Could you tell me your official job title?' — 'It's Data Processing Manager.'
example.tran: “能告诉我您的正式职务名称吗？”——“数据处理部经理。”

entry.def: If a person or team wins a particular title, they win a sports competition that is held regularly. Usually a person keeps a title until someone else defeats them.

example.ex: He became Jamaica's first Olympic gold medallist when he won the 400m title in 1948...
example.tran: 他 1948 年赢得 400 米冠军，成为牙买加第一位奥运会金牌得主。

example.ex: Gary Kasparov has retained his title as world chess champion.
example.tran: 加雷·卡斯帕罗夫卫冕了他国际象棋世界冠军的称号。

entry.def: Title is the legal ownership of something, especially land or property.

example.ex: He never had title to the property.
example.tran: 他从来就不具有这项财产的所有权。

means.word_mean: 1. a heading that names a statute or legislative bill; may give a brief summary of the matters it deals with;
2. the name of a work of art or literary composition etc.;

sentences.sentence: "he looked for books with the word `jazz' in the title"
"he refused to give titles to his paintings"

means.word_mean: 3. a general or descriptive heading for a section of a written work;
4. the status of being a champion;

sentences.sentence: "he held the title for two years"

means.word_mean: 5. a legal document signed and sealed and delivered to effect a transfer of property and to show the legal right to possess it;

sentences.sentence: "he kept the title to his car in the glove compartment"

means.word_mean: 6. an identifying appellation signifying status or function: e.g. Mr. or General;

sentences.sentence: "the professor didn't like his friends to use his formal title"
"a strong legal claim to the property"
"he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate"

means.word_mean: 8. (usually plural) written material introduced into a movie or TV show to give credits or represent dialogue or explain an action;

sentences.sentence: "the titles go by faster than I can read"
"`your majesty' is the appropriate title to use in addressing a king"

Sentence.sentence: A 2012 press release from Statistics Sweden bears the title "Gender Equality in Sweden Treading(踩)Water" and notes: 1、The total income from employment for all ages is lower for women than for men
they have enjoyed the protection of government agencies with titles like the Ministry of Integration and Gender Equality and the Secretariat of Gender Research.
So far, Google has scanned more than 10 million titles from libraries in America and Europe - including half a million volumes held by the Bodleian in Oxford.

jushi.english: Has Britain the title to this island?
jushi.chinese: 这个小岛是否归英国所有?

jushi.english: He managed to defend his title in the men's singles.
jushi.chinese: 他在男子单打比赛中卫冕成功。

jushi.english: The title of this play is Hamlet .
jushi.chinese: 这个剧的剧名是《哈姆雷特》。
